chess

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game class runs the Chess program.
    Author:
    Andrew Wang, Rumzi Tadros

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Game constructor. Will also attempt to take an input text file for debugging.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
        Method to play or end game. If/else statements for different possibilities: Continue, in check, draws, stalemates, checkmates, resignation.

      • isCheckmate

        public boolean isCheckmate()
        Method for checking if a player is in stalemate.
        Returns:
        boolean - true for stalemate,

      • isInCheck

        public boolean isInCheck()
        Method for checking if a player is in check. Checks by generating movesets, and seeing if any piece's move set includes the king's position.
        Returns:
        true if king is in check.

      • players_turn

        public void players_turn()
        Method for turn, as well as input error checking.

      • parse_move

        public Move parse_move(java.lang.String input)
        Converts input lines into Move objects by converting to octal values
        Parameters:
        input - The line input that a player enters (e.g: e2 e4)
        Returns:
        Move object representing the player's input

      • play_move

        public boolean play_move(Move m)
        Method to play a move
        Parameters:
        m - Move object to be performed
        Returns:
        boolean value for move success/failure

      • try_move

        public boolean try_move(Move m)
        Helper method for play_move.
        Parameters:
        m - Move to be played.
        Returns:
        boolean to see if move is viable.

      • do_move

        public void do_move(Move m)
        Helper method for play_move. Actually performs the move after testing viability.
        Parameters:
        m - The move to be played.
